intro: Erigeron polycladus, commonly known as blueweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as prairies, roadsides, and disturbed soils. It features silver-gray foliage and produces blue to purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. Erigeron polycladus is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
